data.title: Aussie Tom Slingsby sails to Laser Olympic gold
data.meta_description: WEYMOUTH, England —  A dip in the chilly English Channel never felt so good. Tom Slingsby of Australia won the Olympic sailing gold medal in the men’s Laser class Monday by match-racing his closest competitor, Pavlos Kontides of Cyprus, to the back of the fleet. After crossing the line in ninth place in the medals race, […]
data.text:
WEYMOUTH, England — A dip in the chilly English Channel never felt so good.

Tom Slingsby of Australia won the Olympic sailing gold medal in the men’s Laser class Monday by match-racing his closest competitor, Pavlos Kontides of Cyprus, to the back of the fleet.

After crossing the line in ninth place in the medals race, Slingsby, a tactician with America’s Cup champion Oracle Racing, capsized his boat in celebration. He couldn’t resist capsizing again a few minutes later, then waved the Australian flag at a big group of supporters watching from Nothe Fort, including his parents.

Later, he planned to down a few rums in the pub that the Aussies have adopted.

Kontides took the silver, securing the first-ever Olympic medal for his small island nation.

China’s Xu Lijia won the women’s Laser Radial gold.
